text: Java Edition Beta
Pre-release 2 ;)
Java Edition
pre
Bedrock Edition
Piston heads have an unobtainable item form corresponding to its block ID. It can be obtained via inventory editors with numeric item ID 34.
The moving piston has an unobtainable item form corresponding to its block ID. It can be obtained via inventory editors with numeric item ID 36.
Both blocks do not appear to be able to be placed.
If certain colors of cloth were obtained in a world prior to their mass removal in late Infdev, items of these could convert forward into piston head or moving piston items.
Added pick block functionality. This will change the currently selected slot to any containing these otherwise-unobtainable items, but will not allow them to be obtained if not already in the hotbar.
Piston heads and moving pistons can now be obtained via Pick Block in creative.
Using pick block on a piston head or moving piston now causes a game crash.
Piston head and moving piston items can now be obtained in singleplayer worlds via the /give command using their respective numeric IDs.
Piston heads and moving pistons can no longer be obtained with pick block in Creative.
The direct item forms of piston heads and moving pistons have been removed from the game. They can no longer exist as an item in any way, only as placed blocks.
Sticky piston heads are now a separate block ID from piston heads.
Java Edition Beta
Java Edition
Bedrock Edition
The piston head item uses this texture in inventories, when held in first or third person view or as a dropped item.
The piston head item now uses the aforementioned texture when in an item frame.
The piston head block uses this item texture.[1]
The piston head block uses this item texture.

Bedrock Edition
The moving piston item uses this texture in inventories, when held in first or third person view or as a dropped item.
The moving piston item now uses this texture in inventories, when held in first or third person view or as a dropped item.
This is due to the grass top texture changing in this version.
The moving piston item now uses the aforementioned texture when in an item frame.
The moving piston item now uses this texture in inventories, when held in first or third person view, as a dropped item or when in an item frame.
This is due to major texture storage changes in this version.
The moving piston block uses this item texture.[2]
